newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Hong Kong swears in last Queen's Counsels.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong swears in last Queen's Counsels.

text.p: It will be a short-lived honour, lasting just 52 days.
A ceremony was held on Saturday elevating the last six Hong Kong lawyers to the rank of Queen's Counsel -- "taking silk" in legal parlance.
The honour allows them to put the letters QC after their names until Hong Kong reverts to China on July 1. QCs are senior lawyers in Britain and certain other Commonwealth coutries.
When China resumes sovereignty, such vestiges of the colonial past will be consigned to the dustbin of history.
The "silks" will retain their gowns, flowing horsehair wigs, white knee-high stockings and patent leather shoes, but will be known merely as Senior Counsels.
